doc:
Katy Jurado https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Katy_Jurado 0 María Cristina Estela Marcela Jurado García (16 January 1924 – 5 July 2002), better known as Katy Jurado, was a Mexican film, stage, and television actress. Jurado began her acting career in Mexico in 1943. From the 1940s through the early 1960s, the era called the Golden Age of Mexican cinema, Jurado played villainous "femme fatale" characters in Mexican films. In 1951 she was discovered in Mexico by the filmmaker Budd Boetticher and began her Hollywood career in the film The Bullfighter and the Lady. She acted in Western films of the 1950s and 1960s, including High Noon (1952), Arrowhead (1953), Broken Lance (1954), One-Eyed Jacks (1961), and Pat Garrett and Billy the Kid (1973). She was the first Latin American actress nominated for an Academy Award, as Best Supporting Actress for her work in Broken Lance, and was the first to win a Golden Globe Award for her performance in High Noon. María_Cristina_Estela_Marcela_Jurado_García ( 16_January_1924 – 5_July_2002 ) , better_known as Katy_Jurado , was a_Mexican_film , stage , and television_actress . Jurado began her acting career in Mexico in 1943 . From the_1940s through the_early_1960s , the_era called the_Golden_Age of Mexican_cinema , Jurado played villainous_"_femme_fatale_"_characters in Mexican_films . In 1951 she was_discovered in Mexico by the_filmmaker_Budd_Boetticher and began her_Hollywood_career in the_film The_Bullfighter and the_Lady . She acted in Western_films of the_1950s_and_1960s , including High_Noon_(_1952_) , Arrowhead_(_1953_) , Broken_Lance_(_1954_) , One-Eyed_Jacks_(_1961_) , and Pat_Garrett and Billy the_Kid_(_1973_) . She was the_first_Latin_American_actress nominated for an_Academy_Award , as_Best_Supporting_Actress for her_work in Broken_Lance , and was the_first to_win a_Golden_Globe_Award for her_performance in High_Noon .
